doc:
Art Fowler (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Art_Fowler_(actor) 0 Art "Dustbowl" Fowler (1902 – April 4, 1953) was an American actor and musician known as "The Wizard of the Ukulele". He played tenor ukulele accompanied by a gentle croon. Among his hits are "No Wonder She's a Blushing Bride", "Crazy Words, Crazy Tune" and "Just A Bird's Eye View of my Old Kentucky Home". From Oklahoma, Fowler took up ukulele around 1922, playing professionally from 1925 with his first professional performance at the Metropolitan Picture House in Los Angeles. He went on to tour internationally and in 1927 he travelled to England for a series of performances after being discovered by Gerald Samson while performing in New York City. Art_"_Dustbowl_"_Fowler ( 1902 – April_4_,_1953 ) was an_American_actor_and_musician known as " The_Wizard of the_Ukulele_" . He played tenor_ukulele accompanied by a_gentle_croon . Among his_hits are " No_Wonder She 's a_Blushing_Bride " , " Crazy_Words , Crazy_Tune " and " Just A_Bird 's_Eye_View of my_Old_Kentucky_Home_" . From Oklahoma , Fowler took up ukulele around 1922 , playing professionally from 1925 with his_first_professional_performance at the_Metropolitan_Picture_House in Los_Angeles . He went on to_tour internationally and in 1927 he travelled to England for a_series of performances after being_discovered by Gerald_Samson while performing in New_York_City .
